12.10.text:
JASON SILVA: You know,
mankind is a symbolic species,

15.03.text:
which means that even physical
pleasures-- trivial things

18.80.text:
for other animals, mating
habits, eating, reproduction,

22.06.text:
so and so forth-- to us
become cosmic acts impregnated

27.78.text:
We are travelers in
search of signification,

30.75.text:
and so even sensuality has
been turned into poetry.

34.27.text:
Apes have sex, human
beings make love, you know.

36.82.text:
And Alan Harrington has this
great line where he says,

39.07.text:
sensuality may itself
turn into a feverish hunt

42.47.text:
for rebirth, for apotheosis,
for symbolic catharsis.

46.26.text:
And I just love this idea that
us-- as this meaning making

49.87.text:
species, this symbolic
representational species-- all

53.13.text:
the pleasure that we seem
to get from the world

55.38.text:
comes from the story
we tell ourselves

58.20.text:
Like, we become the paint
brush, we become the meaning.

61.49.text:
We are the answer to the
question we're asking,

64.14.text:
and I think that
loop is fascinating.
